intro: Oxytropis aigulak, commonly known as the Altai locoweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Oxytropis aigulak is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in steppes and rocky areas. It is known for its toxic properties, containing alkaloids that can be harmful to livestock.
